item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 10, 2024 at 11:10 AM UTC
item.description:
1. OpenCoder: Open Cookbook for Top-Tier Code Large Language Models (462 points | 51 comments)
2. IronCalc – Open-Source Spreadsheet Engine (459 points | 137 comments)
3. Audio Decomposition – open-source seperation of music to constituent instruments (46 points | 7 comments)
4. Shaderblocks: Block-based image editing (81 points | 12 comments)
5. Show HN: Visprex – Open-source, in-browser data visualisation tool for CSV files (136 points | 16 comments)
6. NYC Subway Station Layouts (202 points | 63 comments)
7. Physical Intelligence's first generalist policy AI can finally do your laundry (109 points | 61 comments)
8. Show HN: Jaws – a JavaScript to WASM ahead-of-time compiler (209 points | 79 comments)
9. Mind-Bending Soviet Era Oil Rig City on the Caspian Sea (14 points | 2 comments)
10. FrontierMath: A benchmark for evaluating advanced mathematical reasoning in AI (120 points | 61 comments)
11. Mergiraf: a syntax-aware merge driver for Git (362 points | 76 comments)
12. Zig's (.{}){} Syntax (188 points | 104 comments)
13. Measuring keyboard-to-photon latency with a light sensor (2023) (17 points | 4 comments)
14. GenMC: Model checking for concurrent C programs (19 points | discuss)
15. Pushed Authorization Requests (Par) in Asp.net Core 9 (15 points | 4 comments)
16. A skeleton made from the bones of at least eight people thousands of years apart (66 points | 17 comments)
17. Show HN: HTML-to-Markdown – convert entire websites to Markdown with Golang/CLI (300 points | 46 comments)
18. Hard Cases for a Handle Theory (22 points | 2 comments)
19. Grim Fandango (225 points | 72 comments)
20. When machine learning tells the wrong story (152 points | 14 comments)
21. Early Cascade Injection: From Windows process creation to stealthy injection (103 points | 11 comments)
22. Texture-Less Text Rendering (193 points | 47 comments)
23. You too can write a book (148 points | 51 comments)
24. Obtainium: Get Android App Updates Directly from the Source (200 points | 80 comments)
25. Scientist treated her own cancer with viruses she grew in the lab (524 points | 183 comments)
26. Somebody moved the UK's oldest satellite in the mid 1970s, but no one knows who (131 points | 68 comments)
27. Since the '60s, Ford has stored cars underground in a Kansas City cave (175 points | 68 comments)
28. Notes on Guyana (144 points | 108 comments)
29. Show HN: Dracan – Open-source, 1:1 proxy with simple filtering/validation config (13 points | 4 comments)
30. Can humans say the largest prime number before we find the next one? (300 points | 133 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 10, 2024 at 11:10 AM UTC
